p: During the SARS outbreak in 2003, an animal study revealed that recombinant human IFN-α2b spray can prevent SARS-CoV infection in Rhesus monkey model by inhibiting virus infection and replication [ 11]. Further population study revealed that recombinant human IFN-α2b spray can effectively reduce the infection rate of respiratory syncytial virus, influenza virus, adenovirus and SARS-CoV [ 12, 13]. The Novel Coronavirus Infection Pneumonia Diagnosis and Treatment Standards ( the fourth edition) and Diagnosis, treatment and prevention of 2019 novel coronavirus infection in children: experts’ consensus statement also listed IFN-α atomization as a choice of treatment for 2019-nCoV pneumonia [ 14].
